event.comment: doesn't show this chart. The ratio of 'iutlb_dep_stall/l1i_tlb_refill' is wildly off

tot_line_options.desc: Based on l1d_cache_refill/cycle. Counts demand misses only and not prefetchs or writebacks.

Based on 64*l1d_cache_refill/cycle.  Every miss causes a 64 byte cache line transfer. This is just demand misses and not count L1d_writebacks or prefetchs. This is part a component of L2_access_bytes/cycle.
Based on 64*l2d_cache_refill/cycles. Max possible BW seems to be about 2 GB/sec.
Based on 64*l2d_cache_refill GB/sec. Max possible BW seems to be about 2 GB/sec.

Based on 64*l1d_cache_wb/cycle.  Assume every writeback causes a 64 byte cache line transfer. This is just L1d_writebacks and not L1d_misses or prefetchs. This is part a component of L2_access_bytes/cycle.

Based on 64*prefetch_linefill/cycles. Assume every prefetch causes a 64 byte cache line transfer. This is just L1d_prefetch and not L1d_misses or writebacks. This is part a component of L2_access_bytes/cycle.

Based on 64*l2d_cache bytes/cycle.  I assume every access causes a cache line transfer. I think Cortex A53 L1d can read 32 bytes/cycle from L2, L1d can write 16 bytes/cycle and L1i can read 16 bytes of instructions/cycle.

Based on 64*l2d_cache/cpu-clock (GB/sec). Assume every access causes a cache line transfer. I think Cortex A53 can read 32 data bytes/cycle, write 16 data bytes/cycle and read 16 bytes of instructions/cycle. So max read data bw would be 44 GB/sec
